result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A. Purnell

records.addlTxt: 5/27/16 Arraignment filed by Court Reporter Marjorie Kurtz

Defendant Michael A. Purnell in court, in custody with attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called 16CF45, 16TR750,751, and 16TR752R. In 16TR752R DOB needs to be changed to 4-11-1965. In 16TR750 defendant pled no contest. Court found guilty. Judgment entered. Court sentenced the defendant to pay $893.50 fines/costs. Bond on hand from16CF45 to be applied towards all fines/costs in 16TR750 and 16TR752R. 16CF45 and 16TR751 Dismissed and read in.

Filed by District Attorney Jane Kohlwey

Cases called: 16CF45, 16CF141, 16CF142, 16CF187, Defendant Michael A. Purnell in court with attorney Brian William Severson.  Jane Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CF45 heard first: State called Dep. Max Jenatscheck, sworn Direct exam. Exh. 1 (blood results) marked, offered, and received. Exh. 2 (driving record) marked, offered, and received. Cross exam; witness excused. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.   Information filed, reading waived. Defendant plead not guilty. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set.   16CF142 heard: State called Officer Sara Ruth (Portage PD), sworn. Direct exam.  Exh. 1 (driving record) marked, offered and received. Exh. 2 (bond in 16CF45) marked, offered and received. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Cross exam; witness excused.  Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set.   16CF141 heard: State called Officer Sara Ruth (Portage PD); sworn.  Direct exam.  Exh. 1 (blood test results) marked, offered and received.  Exh. 2 identified; marked, offered, and received.   Exh. 3 (bond in 16CF45) received by the court. Cross exam; witness excused.  Atty. Severson objected to bindover. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.   Information filed, reading waived. Defendant plead not guilty. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set.   16CF187 called: Reading waived on Amended Complaint. State called Deputy Craig Crary, sworn.  Direct exam.Exh. 1(bonds in 16CF142/16CF141) & 2 (16CF45) marked, offered and received. Cross exam. Attorney Severson objected to bind over.  Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.   Information filed, reading waived. Defendant plead not guilty. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set.

Cases called: 16CF141, 16CF142, 15CM668, 16CF45, 16CF187 & 16CM59, Defendant Michael A. Purnell in court with attorney Brian William Severson, stated defendant just had surgery, requested preliminary hearings on the felonies.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Severson entered not guilty pleas on misdemeanor cases and jury trials be set. Court entered not guilty pleas in misdemeanor cases and ordered trials be set. Bonds continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 28, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant, Michael A. Purnell, appeared in custody with Atty. Benavides from public defender office. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Address correct. $1,000 cash bond with felony conds, not operate motor vehicle without valid driver's license. Maintain absolute sobriety at all times. Time limits waived.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 10:40 am.  Return date scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
